abstract: To ease Chinese antitrust concerns, Glencore said it would sell a Peruvian copper mine owned by Xstrata. Glencore also said Mick Davis would step down as chief executive of Xstrata as soon as the takeover was completed.
snippet: To ease Chinese antitrust concerns, Glencore said it would sell a Peruvian copper mine owned by Xstrata. Glencore also said Mick Davis would step down as chief executive of Xstrata as soon as the takeover was completed.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – The commodities trader Glencore International received final regulatory approval from China on Tuesday, clearing the way for its proposed $30 billion takeover of the mining company Xstrata.

headline.main: Glencore Wins China’s Blessing for Its $30 Billion Takeover of Xstrata
